reviews.review_text: I'll be honest, this game is actually fun just like the good old Magical Drop games for the arcade (at least if you're lucky enough to avoid the so reported crashes like me).  Unfortunately I just can't recommend this game because its developers proved themselves to be extremely incompetent. They promised a big patch and never released it nor even mentioned about it ever again since 2013. The game, albeit functional, is clearly unfinished. I don't think they deserve your dollar if they'll keep lacking some proper devs and a proper PR department. They abandoned this game, plain and simple.  Golgoth Studio should be ashamed and learn a lesson.

Don't be fooled by the notion of Magical Drop on the PC, this is a complete mess by a hack of a publisher. If it seems colorful well, I'm in a bit of an AVGN mood.  For starters, the personality and plot of the cast was more or less written over with generic stuff. This in itself might not be such a gamebreaker if the gameplay itself was good, sadly THAT IS NOT the case.  The game freaking crashes half the time when you start it up. It's like the game itself is trying to save you from it.  Got the game loaded up nice and good? There's not alot beyond versus and story mode, where in the latter you'll run into some cowcrap difficulty where the AI will smack you around far too easily. That leaves versus mode which may work well, but it'd involve inflicting this upon your friends.  Even if it's on super sale, that money's better off someplace else.

If you like the franchise then stick with Magical Drop 3, really.  This version lacks charm, polish and balance; The AI difficulty is so messy it's not even funny. Matches are lost just because the CPU character is moving absurdly fast, while... The Player character feels slow and unresponsive.  All in all, avoid it like the plague.

This game's a lot of fun and reminds me a lot of the days of my severe Bust a Move addiction! But, while I was fine with the dudes from Bust a Move being nekkid since they were dinosaurs and dinosaurs didn't wear pants, imagine my embarrasment when my daughter walked in while I was playing Magical Drop V and her first comment was 'That other girl should really be wearing clothes.'   But beyond that, it's a pretty fun puzzler. I'm going to try multiplayer soon, but I swear I'm not being a creeper, I just like puzzle games. For serious. No, really!

Magical Drop V is an interesting, fun, fast-paced game, but it is extremely rough around the edges and randomly quite brutal. The graphics are decent, and the designs of the game are nice (though perhaps not the series' best).  It's worth the price on sale and is fun for as long as it's playable for you. The game itself can be fun, but there is no difficulty curve. Just difficulty. Even on Normal. One minute the game will be challenging enough to be fun, and then suddenly you'll spend the next five rounds swearing that the AI is cheating and wondering if you really should have bought this game until you ultimately rage quit or win by pure luck. This especially happens with the special Ghostlop mode, which can be smooth sailing until its impossible-seeming final boss.  'Auto-save' is also apparently broken, it seems. My personal control settings are never saved and I have to play the tutorial every time I start up the game again. For a while I thought this was just because my display name had special characters in it, but ever since changing my display name it still glitched.  The translation is unrefined though and at times incomprehensible. The game was obviously made for Magical Drop fans, but some of the dialogue exchanges probably aren't any more understandable with background knowledge.   Thankfully, the developers seem to be listening to fans and are still patching the game, so maybe it'll get better. But at the same time, the patch seems to be delayed and the gaem's been released just too long for its current problems to be excusable.  I truly WANT to like this game. I do. But perhaps I would be better off seeking out the previous entries in the series rather than letting this one constantly disappoint me.    EDIT:  Since I bought this game, it has dropped down to $0.99  For that price, I suppose it's a good enough buy if you don't have a previous Magical Drop or don't have a similar game. That's a low enough price for it to just be a novelty, so if you're interested in it then $0.99 is a fine price for it.
